input.context: PLC stopped responding after power fluctuation. Red SF LED flashing on CPU module.

expected_output.root_cause: Profibus communication cable fault or termination resistor failure
safety_critical_warnings: Do not hot-swap modules while powered
repair_steps: 1. Verify lockout/tagout
2. Check Profibus cable continuity
3. Verify 120-ohm termination resistors at both ends
4. Inspect connectors for damage
5. Replace cable if continuity test fails
manual_citations: Siemens S7-1200 System Manual v4.5 Section 9.2

input.context: Remote I/O modules intermittently losing connection. Production line stops randomly.

expected_output.root_cause: Network switch overload or faulty Ethernet cable causing packet loss
safety_critical_warnings: Lock out line before inspecting I/O modules
Verify zero energy state on all pneumatic/hydraulic systems
Wear arc-rated PPE when working in electrical cabinet
repair_steps: 1. Implement lockout/tagout on affected line
2. Check switch port statistics for errors
3. Replace Ethernet cables with Cat6 rated cables
4. Update switch firmware if outdated
5. Add managed switch with QoS for deterministic communication
manual_citations: Industrial Ethernet Planning and Installation Manual

input.context: Drive trips on deceleration. Motor is controlling a heavy conveyor with 500kg load.

expected_output.root_cause: Regenerative braking energy exceeds drive's dissipation capacity, causing DC bus overvoltage
safety_critical_warnings: Wait 5 minutes for DC bus capacitors to discharge
Measure DC bus voltage before touching - expect 600-800VDC
repair_steps: 1. Lock out and tag out drive power
2. Wait minimum 5 minutes for capacitor discharge
3. Verify DC bus voltage is below 50V with multimeter
4. Install external braking resistor (ABB part# 3AUA0000123456)
5. Configure drive parameter 99.04 to enable braking chopper
6. Set decel time to 15 seconds minimum (parameter 22.03)

input.context: Safety-rated light curtain showing channel mismatch. E-stop circuit compromised.

expected_output.root_cause: Dual-channel safety input has one channel stuck high, indicating sensor wiring fault or failed light curtain receiver
safety_critical_warnings: Lock out machine until safety system is verified functional
Safety circuit fault requires qualified safety technician
Machine must not operate with degraded safety inputs per OSHA 1910.147
repair_steps: 1. Implement lockout/tagout on entire machine
2. Test light curtain with test wand - both channels must respond
3. Inspect wiring for shorts or opens
4. Replace light curtain receiver if self-test fails
5. Perform full safety validation per IEC 61511 before returning to service
6. Document repair in safety log per company SOP
manual_citations: Schneider M580 Safety Manual Part 3 Chapter 9

input.context: Servo-driven indexing table not reaching target position. Position error grows with each move.

expected_output.root_cause: Mechanical binding in indexing table or servo tuning parameters incorrect for load inertia
safety_critical_warnings: Lock out servo drive before mechanical inspection
Heavy table can drop if brake fails - use mechanical blocks
Verify servo drive is disabled before manually rotating table
repair_steps: 1. Lock out servo drive power
2. Manually rotate table to check for binding or obstruction
3. Inspect coupling between servo and table for wear
4. If mechanical OK, re-tune servo using auto-tuning function (parameter 1-08)
5. Increase position loop gain if load is heavy (parameter 1-00)
6. Test with reduced speed first (parameter 0-04 = 500 RPM)
manual_citations: Servo Tuning Guide for MR-J4 Series
